string.text: Mortal Sin: Mysterious Envoy
General Voronin wants you to interrogate a mysterious envoy who pesters stalkers in the 100 Rads bar.
You have obtained some useful information from the envoy. Report to General Voronin.
You have obtained some useful information and killed the mysterious envoy. Report to General Voronin.
Dushman wants you to interrogate a mysterious envoy who pesters mercs in the Dead City base.
You have obtained some useful information from the envoy. Report to Dushman.
You have obtained some useful information and killed the mysterious envoy. Report to Dushman.
Sidorovich wants you to interrogate a mysterious envoy who pesters stalkers in the Rookie Village.
You have obtained some useful information from the envoy. Report to Sidorovich.
You have obtained some useful information and killed the mysterious envoy. Report to Sidorovich.
Cold wants you to interrogate a mysterious envoy who pesters stalkers in the Hidden Base.
You have obtained some useful information from the envoy. Report to Cold.
You have obtained some useful information and killed the mysterious envoy. Report to Cold.
Lukash wants you to interrogate a mysterious envoy who pesters stalkers in the Freedom HQ.
You have obtained some useful information from the envoy. Report to Lukash.
You have obtained some useful information and killed the mysterious envoy. Report to Lukash.
Professor Sakharov wants you to interrogate a mysterious envoy who pesters guards near the mobile bunker lab.
You have obtained some useful information from the envoy. Report to Professor Sakharov.
You have obtained some useful information and killed the mysterious envoy. Report to Professor Sakharov.
Vodnik's notes

"Many have joined our cause, whether they understood the magnificence of the Zone from the beginning, or required some explanation. I envy the Founders; they were created by the Masters themselves, they could witness the birth of Vyraj! But they cleansed us, judging us worthy, and they'll cleanse our new brothers. Together, we'll spread the word across the whole world."
Mortal Sin: Red Forester
Talk to Forester about possible Sin activity going on in the Red Forest.
Mortal Sin: Red Forest Haunters
Forester deduced where the mysterious stalkers you're investigating may have set up camp. Confront them.
Search the bodies for any useful information.
Sin Squad Leader's PDA

This PDA used to belong to the squad leader. Contains a map of the Red Forest with a set of marked locations, an unchecked one among them. Seems the squad was pursuing someone, and that they were very close to finding them. There is also a lot of additional encrypted data; might be valuable.
Mortal Sin: Runaway
The Sinners were pursuing someone. They were supposed to check mines to the west next. Go investigate in their stead.
Mortal Sin: Needle in a Haystack
Stitch requires his hacking device for an important task. Retrieve the item from one of the wrecked buses in the middle of the Truck Cemetery.
You have found the hacking device. Bring it back to Stitch.
Stitch's decoder
This somewhat outdated hacking device belongs to Stitch. Should be compatible with equally outdated pieces of technology scattered across the Zone.
Mortal Sin: Situation Report
According to Stitch, Sin's been preparing a large-scale campaign. Report your findings to General Voronin.
According to Stitch, Sin's been preparing a large-scale campaign. Report your findings to Dushman.
According to Stitch, Sin's been preparing a large-scale campaign. Report your findings to Sidorovich.
According to Stitch, Sin's been preparing a large-scale campaign. Report your findings to Cold.
According to Stitch, Sin's been preparing a large-scale campaign. Report your findings to Lukash.
According to Stitch, Sin's been preparing a large-scale campaign. Report your findings to Professor Sakharov.
Mortal Sin: Ambush
Sin forces are invading the Bar. You have to fend them off.
You have repelled the enemy assault. Report to General Voronin.
Sin forces are invading Dead City. You have to fend them off.
You have repelled the enemy assault. Report to Dushman.
Sin forces are invading the Rookie Village. You have to fend them off.
You have repelled the enemy assault. Report to Sidorovich.
Sin forces are invading the Fishing Hamlet. You have to fend them off.
You have repelled the enemy assault. Report to Cold.
Sin forces are invading the headquarters. You have to fend them off.
You have repelled the enemy assault. Report to Lukash.
Sin forces are assaulting the mobile bunker. You have to fend them off.
You have repelled the enemy assault. Report to Professor Sakharov.
Mortal Sin: Dark Crusade
Sin poses a considerable threat to the stalker community as a whole. Do what you can to stop them.
Chernobog plans to expand the Zone to span the whole world. He must be stopped.
Mortal Sin: Preemptive Strike
Sin attempts to reactivate the Miracle Machine. Kill the sentry squad near the entrance to the lab.
Sin attempts to reactivate the Miracle Machine. Descend to the lab and kill any enemies you encounter.
Sin attempts to reactivate the Miracle Machine. Prevent the final squad from succeeding.
Sin attempts to reactivate the Brain Scorcher. Travel to Radar and eliminate all hostile forces to prevent them from doing so.
Mortal Sin: To War
Upon their failure to reactivate the psy-installations, Sin declared open war. Travel to Limansk to contact Rogue and form a united front.
Mortal Sin: Urban Warfare
Sin forces occupy most of Limansk. Assassinate their leadership to disrupt them.
You have defeated the Sin Castigators. Report your success to Rogue.
Drekavac's notes

"Finally, after several years of arduous preparation, we can continue the Masters' plan. It's regrettable that so many people don't believe us, but sometimes words aren't enough. They're blinded by base human desires. If they insist on continuing their violent ways, we'll treat them with violence. Maybe then they will understand. The seed of Vyraj is budding, and I'm here to spread the paradise further and further beyond. I am the tip of the spear."
Mortal Sin: Prisoner of War
Rogue managed to capture a Sin member. Interrogate him to obtain useful intel.
Mortal Sin: Contact Lost
The scout team sent by Rogue didn't return from their mission. Investigate the situation.
You have managed to obtain some intel from the team. Return to Rogue.
Scout team leader's PDA
This PDA used to belong to the leader of the scout team. He had managed to record some information about the enemy forces before his untimely demise.
Mortal Sin: Destruction Site
Sin forces have entrenched in a fortified position on an old construction site. Eliminate them to secure Limansk and access the path to the north.
Mortal Sin: Northern Hospitality
Rout Sin remnants in Limansk to access the Deserted Hospital.
Oust Sin forces from the Deserted Hospital, denying them a stronghold as you push forward to the CNPP.
A telepathic voice called you to the location of a mysterious stalker. Investigate.
Mortal Sin: Heart of the Zone
Eliminate Sin patrols on your way to the north of the CNPP to ensure a safe return trip.
Travel to the ominous area known as the Generators.
An unidentified stalker has contacted you on the PDA. Hopefully, it's an ally.
Mortal Sin: Decisive Blow
Remaining Sin forces are gathering near the main entrance to the War Lab. Attack them to divert their attention away from Strelok's sabotage mission.
Mortal Sin: Confrontation
Sin has critically failed in its mission. Confront Chernobog.
Mortal Sin: Endgame
Pursue Chernobog and prevent him from making his wish with extreme prejudice.
Chernobog's notes

"The Zone is a miracle. The Masters cleansed us. Soon, we thought, the Zone would cleanse the world. But no. Our small paradise was soon trespassed upon by the flawed people of a sinful world. And, in an act of unthinkable atrocity, the beast named Strelok crippled the valiant Monolith, and entered the Masters' chambers to slay their mortal forms. However, I shall not despair. I cannot let this miracle be consumed by the vice and filth of the unworthy. So we, Sin, must embark upon a quest to fulfil the Masters' wish. We shall wage war upon the violent to bring about eternal peace."
Mortal Sin: Choice
Chernobog is dead. Whether you want to use the Wish Granter yourself is your choice.
Talk to the Wish Granter.
Mortal Sin: Hero of the Zone
You have prevented Sin from accelerating the Zone's expansion. Report your success to General Voronin.
You have ensured the Zone stays in its current lucrative state. Report your success to Dushman.
You confronted a threat to stalkers everywhere, and prevailed. Report your success to Sidorovich.
You have prevented the Zone from being thrown out of balance. Report your success to Cold.
You have prevented a tyrant from imposing himself upon the world. Report your success to Lukash.
You have survived an adventure that'd kill most scientists, and kept the Zone safely contained for study. Report your success to Professor Sakharov.
Unquenchable Flame
Sin survivors are gathering in Zaton. You have to eliminate them.

You see, stalker, I know that you've already fought your share of those Sin lunatics, but Beard told me that their remnants are very active. Several stalkers reported that they've been setting up a base in abandoned substation workshops in Zaton. They're endangering my trade routes and I really don't like that. Go silence them for good.
Aren't you the one-man army, huh? Well done, stalker. I hope we won't be hearing of them any more.

You have established quite the reputation by almost single-handedly destroying a whole faction of lunatics. You see, the thing is they haven't been completely destroyed yet. Our guys from the outpost in Zaton reported suspicious activity in abandoned substation workshops nearby, and they're certain it's Sin again. Eliminate them before they start another bloody crusade.
I can always rely on you to finish the job like a true professional. Here's your reward.

Damn, just as I was about to get over almost repeating history from a few years back, those guys come back all of a sudden. Turns out there are Sin survivors regrouping in abandoned substation workshops in Zaton. I know it's quite the trip to reach the place, but I really don't like the idea of them growing stronger in there like some sort of malignant tumour. Take a few of our men and wipe them out.
Ah, well done. I think we've done our share of warfare for the next few years, don't you think?
